name: python-rtmidi
description: A Python binding for the RtMidi C++ library implemented using Cython.
unavailable_reason: Repository is on gitlab, not GitHub. Limited analysis available.

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and quick start example, but lacks inline installation instructions and troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: No installation instructions in README - only mentions documentation has them, requiring users to leave the page

common_complaints: Python version support gaps (Python 3.13 compatibility questions)
Platform-specific bugs (macOS timing issues, Windows MIDI device detection)
Build system problems (case-sensitive filesystem issues, missing dependencies)
Documentation/API clarity (unclear how to retrieve port numbers)
praise_themes: Core functionality works well on primary platform (macOS)
sentiment.summary: python-rtmidi shows moderate maintenance with functional core features but struggling with cross-platform stability, version compatibility, and build system issues that frustrate users on non-macOS systems.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being 3 days ago (indicates inactivity period)
5 open issues with no recent closure activity
No merged PRs in past 6 months
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
positive_signals: Recent commit activity (2026-01-23) suggests sporadic maintenance
maintenance.summary: The project shows signs of abandonment with no development activity over 6 months, unresolved issues, and no recent releases despite a very recent commit.

analysis_summary.unavailable_reason: Repository is on gitlab, not GitHub. Limited analysis available.
